item.title: Pathway flooded and unpassable, 14th November
item.description:
Please can shingle be laid on the main pathway so that we can all use the park during this terrible weather. There are some very large ruts which have been created by IdVerde driving in and out of the park and they do need to drive in and out. But the road/pathway needs to be better. Hence the request for shingle to fill the holes. Can the road also be flattened to help get rid of the ruts. This would greatly help the blind and partially sighted people who visit the park, along with those less abled or those with prams. Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Chase, Widmore, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken street lamp not replaced, 14th November
item.description:
The street lamp outside 20 Lincoln Road was removed over a month ago because it was hanging by one wire, however it has not been replaced and the street is extremely dark presenting a trip and fall hazard. People are having to use their phone lights to get through that bit of road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lincoln Road, North End, Erith, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lifts not working, damaged and filling with graffiti, 14th November
item.description:
Of the three lifts at Village Way Car Park, Beckenham, only one remains working. It is slow, feels precarious and graffiti is steadily building up inside, as this car park is left to rot. I do not feel safe travelling up to my car in this lift. The graffiti needs dealing with, fixes are needed to this last lift, and the other two lifts need to be repaired.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Village Way, Beckenham, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lights not working in stairwell of car park, 14th November
item.description:
The lights are not working in Village Way car park, Village Tower stairwell. This is dangerous when it gets dark, as the stairs are uneven. The photos donâ€™t really show just how dark it is. A whole strip of lights are also not working on level 1 of the car park. This car park is being left to fall to pieces now the council run it. I will report a separate issue related to the car park in another post.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Village Way, Beckenham, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: An abandoned wheelie bin, 14th November
item.description:
An abandoned wheelie bin is infront of 15 ravensbourne road. The bin belongs to no one here. Could you please remove the bin as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravensbourne Road, Shortlands, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 14th November
item.description:
We are managing company of 33-49 Battety rd, we checked cameras and found some evidence that house 31 Battety SE28 0JL flipped large bulky items on our permisses by blocking our block pavement and bin area, in this case council has difficulty to access. We returend these items to owners, but owners brought these items back and left them by blocking bins. Please send them letter asking to remove or penalty for fly tipping. We can provide more evidence. Gallions Reach Management Company

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Newacres Road, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet
